message.content: A metonymy is a figure of speech in which a thing or concept is referred to by the name of something closely associated with that thing or concept. It is a type of trope, or figurative language, and it allows for more creative and expressive ways of communicating ideas. Some common examples of metonymy include referring to the White House as a symbol of the U.S. government, or calling Wall Street a representation of the financial industry.
